project.teaser: MASTERPIECE aims at creating a digital coordination and cooperation arena that will facilitate the creation and operation of energy communities throughout Europe. The facilities given to members of the community to contribute to services and other developments will represent...
project.objective: MASTERPIECE aims at creating a digital coordination and cooperation arena that will facilitate the creation and operation of energy communities throughout Europe. The facilities given to members of the community to contribute to services and other developments will represent the distinction of the solution offered in this proposal, making it participative-by-design. The project's objectives are: i) to develop technical and social innovations to empower traditional energy consumers and to make them active agents of collaborative energy communities, paving the way towards a new energy market paradigm; ii) to create user-centric solutions that are based on participatory approaches such as co-creation and naturally accelerate citizens’ involvement; iii) to propose new business strategies and incentive mechanisms that activate the reactions of market participants craving for business opportunities that imply energy use and cost reduction; iv) to configure a standardised and sound cyber-security infrastructure so the active citizens are protected against cyber-attacks, at the same time that privacy is defended in accordance with the revised EPBD and the GDPR law; and v) to demonstrate the applicability and replicability of methodological, technical and business innovations in a variety of real life pilots in different geographical locations, with heterogeneous social and economic environments and different regulatory/administrative frameworks. MASTERPIECE will follow a staged implementation approach, utilizing use cases with different maturity and TRLs. To demonstrate and evaluate the proposed innovations, it will leverage 4 pilot cases in different geographical areas and within different operational/policy frameworks (France, Italy, Sweden and Turkey).
project.title: Multidisciplinary Approaches and Software Technologies for Engagement, Recruitment and Participation in Innovative Energy Communities in Europe
project.keywords: Energy Community, Social Science and Humanities, Engagement, Awareness

result.title: Community energy solutions for addressing energy poverty: A local case study in Spain
Recommender Systems for Renewable Energy Communities: Tailoring LLM-Powered Recommendations to User Personal Values and Literacy
Modelling consumers and communities
result.description: It will integrate the outcomes of T3.1, T3.2 and T3.3 modelling incentives mechanisms, business models and behavioural patterns.

result.title: Evaluation of social, environmental, technical and economic impact – interim update
result.description: The second version will preliminary analyse the test results from the first demo cycle (M15-M24) to provide a solid overview of the main pros and cons of MASTERPIECE observed in practice.

result.title: Iterative Report of Communication, Dissemination, Engagement, Ecosystem
result.description: It provides two versions of all the activities conducted in T6.1, T6.2, T6.3 and T6.4 during 3 project phases: communication period (M1 to M15), technology and preliminary results dissemination (M16 to M30), dissemination of long-term evaluation and engagement results (M31 to M42).

result.title: Holistic proof-of-concept and pilot implementation roadmaps
result.description: Planning activities to streamline the technical developments at the envisioned pilot sites. The report will consider proof-of-concept, integration, verification and monitoring activities planning - driven by businesses, owners and citizens/occupants needs - as well as prototyping and pilot adaptations.

result.title: Functionalities’ needs and performance measurement planning – update
result.description: It describes the outcomes of T2.3 and T2.4, incl. data sourcing, pilot mapping, use case needs, performance assessment planning (update).

result.title: Business requirements, barriers and regulatory analysis for energy communities
result.description: It describes the state-of-art related to energy communities in the EU and their social aspects. The deliverable performs a comparative analysis on EU member states' situation regarding energy communities' implementation, societal patterns and barriers, business implication and regulatory requirements as the outcomes of T2.1 and T2.2.

result.title: Requirements of the digital platform, conceptual design and definition of the tools for flexibility
result.description: It describes the requirements of the digital platform and other preliminary conceptual designs. Within this deliverable, one could find the conceptual design of the different components that will be developed during the work of the WP. The document will be based on the findings of the necessities of the solution put together with the technical necessities to make sure that the technical barriers are overcome.

result.title: Multi-Agent RL Framework for EV Charging Scheduling Driven by Energy Costs and User Preferences

details.journalTitle: Fourth International Conference on Electrical, Communication and Computer Engineering (ICECCE

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MASTERPIECE (Multidisciplinary Approaches and Software Technologies for Engagement, Recruitment and Participation in Innovative Energy Communities in Europe)
result.teaser: In the evolving energy landscape of Europe, MASTERPIECE stands as a beacon of innovation and collaboration. Funded by the European Union, this project is a decisive step towards redefining the role of individuals in Energy Communities (ECs). By fostering the transition from...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Freeware Digital Platform for Designing Renewable Energy Communities in Italy: An Overview
Assessment of energy communities’ maturity and aspirations in the pilot cases – update
result.description: It will report all main findings and insights of the contextual enquiry in the engaged (see WP5) community hubs. The data will inform the early definition of the behavioural models and the distinctive Journey to become a productive and collaborative energy community (update).

result.title: Evaluating Reinforcement Learning Algorithms in Residential Energy Saving and Comfort Management

details.journalTitle: Advanced Energy Systems in Zero/Positive Energy Buildings, Communities and Districts

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Engagement Plan
result.description: It identifies the main activities for public communication, scientific dissemination and engagement of building stakeholders

result.title: Functionalities’ needs and performance measurement planning
result.description: It describes the outcomes of T2.3 and T2.4, incl. data sourcing, pilot mapping, use case needs, performance assessment planning.

result.title: Evaluation of social, environmental, technical and economic impact
result.description: As an outcome of T5.6, the first version of the current report will be utilising historical and pre-deployment collected data to establish a concrete baseline case as well as preliminary results from the pilot verification and short-term tests.

result.title: Experimental Plan to assess effects and moderators of the intervention programs
result.description: It will establish the identified moderators (i.e., economic, behavioural and social incentives) that can accelerate: a) participation within energy communities, b) learning processes at individual level and c) collaboration patterns between energy communities. The modelling of preferences for each cluster of consumers and prosumers will be the foundation of the Intervention Program of behavioural change to implement in the Pilot Study (T5.2-T5.5).

result.title: Business requirements, barriers and regulatory analysis for energy communities – update
result.description: It describes the state-of-art related to energy communities in the EU and their social aspects. The deliverable performs a comparative analysis on EU member states' situation regarding energy communities' implementation, societal patterns and barriers, business implication and regulatory requirements as the outcomes of T2.1 and T2.2 (update).

result.title: Assessment of energy communities’ maturity and aspirations in the pilot cases
result.description: It will report all main findings and insights of the contextual enquiry in the engaged (see WP5) community hubs. The data will inform the early definition of the behavioural models and the distinctive Journey to become a productive and collaborative energy community.

result.title: Architecture design and functional blueprint – update
result.description: It formalises and synthesises (technically and functionally) all envisaged operational blocks within the project’s conceptual idea, based on the activities foreseen in T2.5. An early version of this report (M9) will support the technical development and integration in WP3-4-5, to be then updated (M24) based on the feedback from pilots’ evaluation in T5.6 (update).

result.title: Smart buildings with legacy equipment: A case study on energy savings and cost reduction through an IoT platform in Ireland and Greece

details.authors: Aristotelis Ntafalias, Panagiotis Papadopoulos, Alfonso P. Ramallo-González, Antonio F. Skarmeta-Gómez, Juan Sánchez-Valverde, Maria C. Vlachou, Rafael Marín-Pérez, Alfredo Quesada-Sánchez, Fergal Purcell, Stephen Wright

result.title: Architecture design and functional blueprint
result.description: It formalises and synthesises (technically and functionally) all envisaged operational blocks within the project’s conceptual idea, based on the activities foreseen in T2.5. An early version of this report (M9) will support the technical development and integration in WP3-4-5, to be then updated (M24) based on the feedback from pilots’ evaluation in T5.6.

result.title: Intervention Program: All pilots implementation
result.description: The planning and progress of the Intervention Program; monitoring for baselining and final long-term (after refining the developed enabling technologies) intervention activities in all four pilot cases, will be coherently reported in the current iterative deliverable. Three versions of the deliverable are foreseen to ensure reporting transparent and solid outcomes at different yet quite important phases of the different pilot demonstration tasks 5.2, 5.3, 5.5 and 5.5. Each subtask is expected to complete and coherently report on M15 (monitored data for baselining and demos planning), M30 (completed first cycle of intervention activities and project prototype deployment), M42 (final intervention execution and monitoring).

result.title: An open ICT solution to integrate multi-modular battery systems on buildings Multi-Agent RL Framework for EV Charging Scheduling Driven by Energy Costs and User Preferences
Requirements of the digital platform, conceptual design and definition of the tools for flexibility – update
result.description: It describes the requirements of the digital platform and other preliminary conceptual designs. Within this deliverable, one could find the conceptual design of the different components that will be developed during the work of the WP. The document will be based on the findings of the necessities of the solution put together with the technical necessities to make sure that the technical barriers are overcome (update).

result.title: Techniques for financial and social planning of sustainable energy community projects
result.description: It describes the financial and social planning performed for each pilot. The two planning activities (financial and social) will be based on data and information coming from the interaction with and among local prosumers and stakeholders.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
